titleStmt.title: Benjamin F. Graves et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG9130

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: To the Honorable Mayor & City Council men, ^Governor of Kentucky^ Your Petitioner Martin Skain would most respectfully request you to remit a fine against him in the City Court of $20. for Assault and Battery charged to have been committed upon Matthew McNamara, No body was hurt and what was done was done under excitement. your petitioner regrets that anything of the kind should have occurred -- he has lived in Lexington Eleven years and this is the first -- time he has been before the City Court

Benj F Graves
Jn Keiser
A Robertson
C. D. Carr
J B Wilgus
J Harper
H. McManus
Wm Swift
Geo Stoll

Lexington City Ct
$20. } Misdemeanor
Martin Skain
